name: The European House - Ambrosetti
goal:
The European House-Ambrosetti is a professional services company, established in 1965, based in Milan, with seven offices in Italy and fourteen offices and business liaison with other partners around the world.
It is an independent organization, which maintains a neutral standpoint on political issues.
Every year The European House-Ambrosetti organizes over 320 Seminars and Forums for top executives and functional managers.
Statesmen, economists, business leaders and Nobel Laureates participate annually in the Ambrosetti Forum “Intelligence on the World, Europe, and Italy”held each September at Villa d’Este on the shores of Lake Como. Since 1974, this Forum is considered as one of the most prestigious events in the international business calendar.
TEHA can count on deep relationships with European Business and Institutional leaders also thanks to the ‘Observatory on Europe’, a European think tank conceived in 2005 to provide high quality studies, analyses and proposals and to help building a stronger Europe, from an economic, social and political standpoint.
Among the other activities: Ambrosetti Club is a business leaders community that counts about 300 members in Italy and about 40 in Brussels, offering them the opportunity to meet up with the most relevant institutional, business and thought leaders on strategic issues.
interests: Banking and financial services, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Institutional affairs, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
